column1: 1 ^ Laetātus sum in hīs quae dicta sunt mihī
column2: « In domum Dominī ībimus. » ^ I rejoiced at the things that were said to me
column3: "We shall go into the house of the Lord."

column1: 2 ^ Stantēs erant pedēs nostrī in ātriīs tuīs
column2: Jerosolima. ^ Our feet were standing in thy courts

column3: cujus participātiō ejus in idipsum. ^ Jerusalem
column4: which is built as a city
ad confitendum nōminī Dominī. ^ For thither did the tribes go up
column7: to praise the name of the Lord.

column1: 5 ^ Quia illīc sēdērunt sēdēs in jūdiciō
column2: sēdēs super domum Dāvid. ^ Because their seats have sat in judgment
column3: seats upon the house of David.

column1: 6 ^ Rogāte quae ad pācem sunt Jerosolimae
column2: et abundantiā dīligentibus tē. ^ Pray ye for the things that are to the peace of Jerusalem
column3: and abundance for them that love thee.

column2: et abundantia in turribus tuīs. ^ Let peace be in thy strength

column1: 8 ^ Propter frātrēs meōs et proximōs meōs
column2: loquēbar pācem dē tē. ^ For the sake of my brethren
quaesīvī bona tibī. ^ Because of the house of the Lord our God
column3: I have sought good things for thee.
